website_summaries.verdict: The versatility of a powerful, and fast-charging dual-port wall charger, and a high-capacity portable charger makes this unit a solid pick.
pros: The combination of a high capacity portable charger, and dual-port wall charger is the main idea here
The 5000maH internal battery holds enough charge for around 3 full phone charges on the go
When plugged in, you can simultaneously charge 2 devices, while charging the portable battery
cons: Its size and weight can be cumbersome for a portable charger
Some users also found that after regular use, devices did not charge as quickly as they did initially

customer_reviews.title: 1 star
customer_reviews.text: One of the most convenient useful chargers I have ever owned. Recommend **** Updated **** I bought two of these. One worked fine but, after about a month and half the other one just started blinking continuously while charging. It hasn't stopped and will no longer charge. My son thinks it was left charging too long and damaged the charger. Never heard of this but, I no longer have a charger. I feel I got a bad product.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonNTexas

customer_reviews.title: Anker failed with this one.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very useful and convenient product. Anker is usually very reliable, however I am disappointed in the quality, after a few uses the middle LED on the battery indicator seems to have gone out, which can get pretty annoying. Additionally I find it odd that one USB port "rapid chargers" my nexus 5x (when using as a battery not plugged into the wall) but the other USB port does not do this. I couldnt find any info this in the manual or online. Edit : no longer charges phones while it is plugged into the Wall. Anker has clearly fallen off with quality control
customer_reviews.author: Richard Dang

customer_reviews.title: The most practical option for a portable charger.
customer_reviews.text: I think this is one of the best portable chargers available -- the integrated plug is very convenient. It has plenty of capacity for me -- 5000 mAH is twice the capacity of my cellphones battery -- without being overly heavy. It fits neatly in my inner coat pocket when my daughter wants to hunt for Pokemon in the mall. It can serve as our wall charger on vacation with its two USB ports. The construction seems very sturdy. I can't recommend this portable charger enough: we've been extremely pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Good solid product
customer_reviews.text: I love everything by Anker. I have two of their PowerCore chargers, micro USB cables, and now this smaller one which I bought to keep in my purse for emergency juice when I get brainless and forget to throw a charge on my phone before I head out. This arrives with a near full charge which is nice. Heck, I even like the packaging. Before I ever buy anything electronic, I always see if Anker makes it first. I'm not easily impressed...this company is as good as it gets.
customer_reviews.author: KarenR

customer_reviews.title: Did this power source ruin my watch??
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately my battery stopped working and affected both my Apple Watch and apple phone. The portable battery would light up as though it had power but neither my watch or phone battery would power up or last when charged. At first I thought it was the USB cord but nothing changed after replacing it. I even assumed my watch was just dying and needed a repair. My watch would get glitchy, flicker, and not respond to touch correctly. However, after I stopped using this battery, my watch started working again! Perhaps my iPhone 6s was fine and not related to this power source.. it’s hard to say since I upgraded phones (which I needed to do anyway).
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Broken at 19 months
customer_reviews.text: It has an 18-month warranty and stopped working at month 19, while I'm on a trip to another state for a conference. I was really banking on this to get me through the long conference days, where charging outlets are hard to come by. Now I'm screwed. I try to charge it, and one light flashes instead of the usual sequence of three. When I press the button, the sequence of three starts, but it never progresses. It shows a complete lack of good will from the company when a product fails right outside of the warranty window.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Alan

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I am a lover of anker and have many of their products. This particular battery back barely last one charge for iPhone x after charging overnight while it's sister, the one that doesn't have a plug built in, has 4 full iPhone X charges in each full overnight charge. I was very excited to see the built in plug and expecting the same type of longevity in each overnight charge but was sorely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Anh Vu

customer_reviews.title: Seems nice, works as expected
customer_reviews.text: This is a good charger/battery combo. Not too big or heavy. Seems durable but time will tell. I believe there's a USB-C variant sold exclusively at Apple stores but it's much more expensive than this one so I'm fine to make do with this USB-A version. I do wish it had one more USB-A port though - I've got three devices I travel with that could benefit and one more port would mean one less block for me to carry. A more granular power level indicator would also be nice. This one only has three LEDs to indicate the battery level. I prefer a numeric read out or one that can display eighths.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip U.

customer_reviews.title: Great all-in-one power source for travel
customer_reviews.text: Now I don't have to carry a wall charger AND a portable battery charger on a trip. One less thing to keep track of, and the red version is hard to miss when packing up. Note that the photos don't show it plugged into a standard U.S. dual wall socket. But it works fne in them -- and it does not block an existing power cord (even a small lamp timer) plugged into the second wall socket. It's a bit heavier than it looks but, hey, it's a 5000mAh battery, too. I also bought a Hermitshell hard case for it to hold two short, 1-foot power cords. Great product, and looks like a great gift, too.
customer_reviews.author: Barry MD

customer_reviews.title: Misleading descriptions lead to angry customer
customer_reviews.text: The description says: "5000mAh provides enough power for around 2 smartphone charges and at least a full charge for other USB devices. Ideal for a weekend away." I bought this based on that phrasing. I was lucky to get 1.5 charge from this while travelling. I called to complain and the rep said my phone's battery (Note 5) was bigger and needed more charge and that it could only charge smaller phones. The description is misleading. There are plenty of other options out there that aren't as heavy to carry around, less expensive, and will actually charge your phone 2 times. I suggest you keep looking. I won't be buying from Anker brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbiladas

customer_reviews.title: great device, maybe some QC issues as others have stated.
customer_reviews.text: the charger works perfectly and as advertised. however, the third led for the charge indicator doesn't work! it's a little disappointing but certainly won't keep me from using the device.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy P.

customer_reviews.title: The thing started giving off a horrible chemical smell
customer_reviews.text: Died After 6 Months... The thing started giving off a horrible chemical smell, and stopped holding a charge. Worked fine while it worked. Had an iPhone 7 and iPad Pro hooked up to it -- too much to handle? Maybe so -- but that's the gear I travel with, so if the charger can't handle that, then it's of no use to me.
customer_reviews.author: Jim_Carroll

customer_reviews.title: "Favorite gift ever!"
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these in December 2018. Both are going strong, zero issues. My daughter said it was the best gift I ever picked out for her. The convenience is priceless. I bought the discontinued 10,000 mAh fusion this year. I assume they had terrible outcomes because they are not even shown in the Anker website. I hope they continue this product line. I would like to see it fast charge iPhone in the future. We have over 40 of Anker's USB products, (cables, chargers, batteries). I have yet to receive a bad one. Some of the batteries eventually lose capacity, but that seems to be affecting all brands. I have used the different brands.
customer_reviews.author: Putra

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this anker product in 2107 and it stopped working in 2018. It just stopped working and would not charge. I called anker due to going on a trip and needing a charger for my iphone. Was told it was out of warranty period and out of luck. Product was defective and only worked for a year. Not a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Anker=Quality
customer_reviews.text: I love Anker anything and this charger rocks! I keep it with me at all times and it’s has been a life saver charging dead cell phones and iPads. I love the convenience of just plugging it into an outlet to recharge. I use the Anker 3 foot lighting charging cable to keep my Apple products up and running when on the go. It’s also served me well keeping my Nook going especially when it’s about to die and I only have 10 pages to go. Anker means quality all the time everytime.
customer_reviews.author: Snowcat60Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Annoyingly disconnects and reconnects endlessly!
customer_reviews.text: My iPhone and iPad both continuously disconnect/reconnect when plugged into the Anker while plugged into the wall. This leads to slow charging and annoying notification sounds every 2-3 seconds. Poor design and poor performance are why I’m returning this charger.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Lavin

customer_reviews.title: Internal Battery failed after the 18 month warranty
customer_reviews.text: I loved this portable charger. I rarely used this device and went to use it the other day, and the battery died. It will still charge when plugged in the wall, but the portable part doesn't work. I checked and there is an 18 month warranty. Although, I've only used this a handful of times, I purchased this through amazon 26 months ago, shortly after the warranty period. So, if you want a portable charger that will last for a short period of time, this is great. But it won't last very long. It's too bad because I really like Anker products. I own several from Bluetooth speakers, earphones, replacement cell phone batteries and charging cables.
customer_reviews.author: J. Guilfoyle

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact I can cut down on cables no need for extra micro usbs. Just plug it in the wall while charging your phone and it'll take care of itself. Really useful only thing is I wish it had a fast charge for phones that are capable. Don't get me wrong it fully charges my Asus Zenfone 5z in about an hour just wish it had Qualcomm.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Flores

customer_reviews.title: Buy it now
customer_reviews.text: I have bigger and smaller portable battery packs and this one is my all time favorite. I love that I don’t have to carry an extra ac wall plug or micro usb cable in order to charge it or my devices once I’ve depleted the battery. The simplicity of it makes you wonder why all battery packs aren’t designed like this.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchkarate

customer_reviews.title: Much more useful than I anticipated
customer_reviews.text: I brought this for a trip but this has become my family’s daily use charger and battery. The usb charger supports fast charging on a Samsung phone , Samsung tablet and an iPhone. It’s small enough that if we need to leave and don’t have a full charge we just take the adapter with us. I have a much larger capacity usb-c battery that almost always stay in a drawer. It’s not powerful enough to run a modern Mac book pro, but it can still provide some power to it. It also lacks a usb-c port, you have to use a 3.1 usb-a to usb-c cable. It’s great for travel and everyday use. Fantastic for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: I've gone through many portable batteries, but this is the one
customer_reviews.text: I've had portable batteries with capacities from 20,000 mHa, to 8,000mHa. I've realized that I rarely ever charge them because I really do not find myself having to even use them often, but I hate carrying them around due to weight/bulk. This is the least heavy, least bulky charger I've ever purchased, and the first with a wall plug feature, which truly seals the deal since it means I never have to carry a mini-USB cord to charge it (I'm an iPhone user). Comes in a mesh bag which is a plus. Can't feel it in my backpack so I already know it won't get in my way.
customer_reviews.author: M. Spector

customer_reviews.title: Must Have for Traveller
customer_reviews.text: This is an absolutely excellent product for people who travel. I keep it in my backpack ( so I can charge my devices are random points. It fits perfectly in the pocket designed specifically for a portable battery. The brilliant part of this device is that I no longer need to bring separate chargers OR portable batteries for my USB devices. Not having to think about charging my battery pack is a game changer. I would highly recommend this product to almost anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Never worry about charging your charger again!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my girlfriend when I first met her because he phone battery was terrible! She's not good with electronics so I thought this would be a perfect fit since all you have to do is use the built in plug to plug it into the wall and not have to worry about having more cords to charge it. Also it can charge its own battery and devices at the same time, making it the ultimate on the run charge. It has worked out great and constantly find myself jealous of it. Highly recomend
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Using this more then my powerbank
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this product whenever i go into the field for the military or might need an extra charge. This product really comes in handy if you need one or two emergency charges just utilizing the Powercore. Very happy on how convenient this product makes carrying an extra charge wherever you go. You don't even need to think about if you charged your powerbank since i normally leave my wall adapters in the wall for convenient charging. Very happy with the quality and the capability it allows me to be. Don't need to worry if I charged my powerbanks prior to going out in the wilderness
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: The forgetful/lazy person's charger
customer_reviews.text: How many battery banks do you own? If you're like me, you own several. Are any of them fully charged right now? Again, if you're like me, they've been dead for a least a month. This is always charged, has two usb ports, and has the ability to prioritize your device charging before it charges the battery. It also doesn't over charge the battery either so no worries about that. It holds enough juice to fully charge most new phones a little more than once. What this thing lacks in capacity, it makes up for with convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Q.

customer_reviews.title: Really liked it while it was working
customer_reviews.text: This was great because it's a compact size and allows for pass through charging (meaning it'll charge the devices connected to it, and then charge itself after). You didn't need to carry a charger and a power bank because it was combined which made it great for travelling. I am giving it a 1 star rating because it failed 3 months out of warranty. I only used it about a dozen times before it stopped charging itself and therefore unable to charge other devices. Very disappointed but it was nice when it worked.
customer_reviews.author: david and rachel

customer_reviews.title: Best charger for the convenience factor.
customer_reviews.text: It’s one of the best chargers I’ve had. It’s convenient because it has a built in plug so you can charge your phone while it’s plugged into the wall, but also a power bank so you can charge on the go. The power bank probably has 1-2 full charges on an iPhone XR, but it’s small enough to be portable. And once you’re done charging with it, find any outlet to recharge the power bank without having to carry a separate charger and cable just for the power bank, because it’s already built in.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene Liao

customer_reviews.title: Must-have Travel Companion
customer_reviews.text: This thing is my must-have travel companion. I travel quite a bit for work, and this little portable battery/charger is awesome because of its portable size and dual function. I never have to go hunting for a free outlet in the airport, and it takes the place of a second wall-charger. It charges up my iPhone XR pretty quickly with extra power for good measure. I’m on my second Anker PowerCore Fusion 5000–but only because I left my first one in a hotel room. It’s a great purchase for a frequent traveler!!
customer_reviews.author: tl_c

customer_reviews.title: Nearly perfect
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product. It's convenient to just use as a multi-port wall charger when you're not traveling. But it's also not too bulky to put in your bag when you think you might need to charge on the go. It can fit in a jacket pocket. I have never worried about it's durability and it seems to be well made. It charges itself when plugged in, so that's one fewer cable to remember when you are traveling on a long trip, which is especially good if you tend to forget/lose things. Downside: No USB-C port. I hope a new version will be released with one as I would buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Wu

customer_reviews.title: nice little device, good to have in my camping kit
customer_reviews.text: i camp a lot with boy scouts and this thing is great, whenever i am around a plug in i can charge it up. if i am not around a charging plug, i can charge it with my solar panels. it is awesome that i can plug it into the wall and plug my phone into it and when my phone is done charging, the battery charges up. that is a great feature. i just wish the battery held a bit more than the 5000, because i would like it to charge my phone multiple times before plugging it in.
customer_reviews.author: Pastor Sasquatch

customer_reviews.title: Really impressed
customer_reviews.text: This charger has really impressed me. I needed something really portable for traveling, in order to keep my gadgets charged at all times. At the same time, i didn’t want to add extra cords to “charge the charger”. This was the solution to my problems. It has enough power to give me the extra juice needed when going on an airplane after a full day using my smartphone and tablet. Maybe it won’t fully charge them both, but will give me enough power for the journey. Wish it had a third usb outlet for my apple watch, but I can manage with two.
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, Reliable Battery Defers Hassle & Expense of Upgrading Old iPhone w/ Short Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: The battery in my iPhone 5s is frequently low or dead, so I keep it plugged in most of the time. (I know; I know. I'm such a Luddite.) Having this charger with its built-in battery means I'm never stranded with a dead phone when I'm away from home. While the battery is sufficient for keeping my phone going, it was quickly drained by my infrared heating pad I attempted to power. Overall, having this battery has deferred the hassle and expense of upgrading to a new phone for now, at least.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa and Josh

customer_reviews.title: which is just nice to have
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had much time with it, but it came in Anker's typical straightforward packaging, which is just nice to have. The little button visible as a dimple on the side displays a simply charge meter, as well as getting another micro USB cable of high quality, just in case. As well it came with a little mesh carrying bag, which I honestly don't need for this, but will probably end up carrying my cables so they don't get caught up in anything else. Overall, very pleased. Anker has easily earned their reputation for affordability and quality; simple styling and practical accessories are a nice little icing on the cake.
customer_reviews.author: B.T. Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Why buy a battery pack that can't charge anywhere?
customer_reviews.text: People are always amazed that my portable charger also plugs in...I don't know why they all don't do that! Be cool, of course, if it was smaller and lighter, but for the extra convenience of being able to charge it anywhere with a plug, it's worth it. The double port is awesome, and it keeps a big charge for a LONG time. It's the best battery life thing I own, after my phone and laptop!
customer_reviews.author: M.S.H.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome 2-in-1 Gadget
customer_reviews.text: Great little battery pack-slash-charger. It's a little bigger than I thought it would be, but not too big to fit in the little side pocket of my backpack, and charges my Pixel XL fully with plenty of charge left over. Just be aware that if it's plugged into a wall socket recharging itself and you plug in your phone, it stops charging itself and uses the charge it has to juice up your phone, and won't recharge itself until you disconnect your phone.
customer_reviews.author: RH72

customer_reviews.title: NOT durable as advertised BUT the best post sale service
customer_reviews.text: I bought these charger con battery pack with original Anker "durable" cables on Sept 28, 2018. I received it a month later. Now, one by one the cables are not working. Definitely NOT durable as advertised. The cables are now currently unavailable thru amazon so i can make a review on those poorly made stuff. However, after only couple of days upon reporting these issues to Anker they've contacted me. Without to many questions, Anker promised and delivered brand new replacement without me returning the defective item. For these, i should give the 4.5 star.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Dy

customer_reviews.title: Another Anker winner!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this power bank/wall charger for my teenage son as a birthday gift. He has not mentioned any issues with this item and carries it with him everywhere thanks to the tech backpack I got him to go with the power bank so he can charge his phone when he is out and about. I own several other Anker products (I also buy them as gifts for my hubby as well) and know they are a solid choice when it comes to tech purchases. Needless to say I am happy with all my Anker products and recommend them to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lyles

customer_reviews.title: It is meh
customer_reviews.text: I got this in hopes of buying a charger that will charger better than my old beat up wall charger. It charges worse than my old charger plugged into the wall. When using it as a power bank it is very lackluster. It doesn't provide the charging power nor performance they say it would. I even took into account that this is a much cheaper power bank than others. I've bought a power bank from a corner store and had better performance :(.
customer_reviews.author: Mark V.

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I bought one to check it out and i liked it so much I ended up buying more 2 more and carry all three in my backpack. It's great because if one dies in just grab another and throw the dead one on the wall to charge. That was my goal. I use to have a 22,000 mAh battery and it sucked recharging and it was beyond bulky. This is just right for charging your phone and then having some left over to keep you at 100% for about an hour sending in how heavy your use is. Great product
customer_reviews.author: JoelMG

customer_reviews.title: The all in one to have in your backpack
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great product. Works awesome overall. I would like it to have at least one witness light more. At least 25% each light. It’s a bit heavy for the battery portable charge of 5mah But it’s okay if you take it on your bagpack and you can forget of taking other chargers with you. This all in one is great. And it has two plugs. And can charge it directly to the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Demian S

customer_reviews.title: Great for traveling, little bulky
customer_reviews.text: bought on 10/10/17 failed on 10.31.19 lasted for 3 years and a few day. The battery in it no longer holds a charge. Great for traveling, and airports. charges 2 devices at once instead of 1 I personally would not buy it again why? I prefer to use the 5 port desk charging instead of this. This is a little bulky to just charge 2 devices. The 5 port is little slimmer and charges 5.
customer_reviews.author: alansunshine

customer_reviews.title: Good solution for traveling. (Working again after total discharge and re-charge).
customer_reviews.text: ***UPDATE*** After totally discharging the battery and plugging in to a different outlet (which should not make any difference) the PowerCore Fusion 5000 is indicating a full charge. Although I never had any charging problems with it in the past, I'll continue to see how it performs on the longer term and update if necessary. Generally quite satisfied with this product. Sellers did reach out to me (to their credit) but so far the charger seems to be working as expected again. Have owned this for 3 months and use occasionally.
customer_reviews.author: pc user

customer_reviews.title: Battery Function Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Well, I think I got a dud. The charger function works (that is when plugged in) but the external battery (power pack) function does not. The LEDs did not light initially so I left the unit plugged in overnight. Even now, when you push the little button the LEDs do not light and the unit will not power my iPhone or iPad from either USB port. Unless there is something I don't understand (I have similar Anger products which work fine) ...I must have gotten a dud. Will call customer service tomorrow and see what they say. I am very disappointed. Was planning to use this item as my primary charge/power source on an upcoming trip. Help!
customer_reviews.author: nled

customer_reviews.title: Stops working after warranty ends
customer_reviews.text: Loved my fusion at first, but it stops working shortly after the warranty ends.
customer_reviews.author: Blaine

customer_reviews.title: Anker chargers work
customer_reviews.text: We've had Anker chargers for years, used solely for travel, and they're the only ones so far that don't stop holding a charge after a year or so. They accept a full charge from an AC socket quickly, and will power an iPhone most of a day and more, even with near-continuous use. We just leave ours plugged in all the time when home, and they just keep on working whenever needed.
customer_reviews.author: synapsys

customer_reviews.title: The best charger I own!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Anker Powercores for years now, but it was always kind of a pain carrying a charger, power core, and cables to charge the phone and powercore. With this just carrying the hybrid charger and a single cable for my phone simplifies everything! The most fun part is using this on the go and getting funny looks from people who think you're trying to use an unplugged wall charger.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Medic NJ

customer_reviews.title: Simple, Portable, and Effective.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice traveling charger. If you're in the airport and all the charging stations are taken, no worries; you've got plenty of power to travel with. I carry this in my edc (Every Day Carry) kit as well. Charge your phone anywhere or share with that friend, you know the one, that never charges their phone before leaving home. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Hakudoshi

customer_reviews.title: The multi-tool of mobile charging
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this charger/battery. When travelling I make sure to charge overnight, since I don't know exactly what the next day will bring. I plug in my phone, watch, and hmmm... no where to plug in my battery in case I need it tomorrow. With this I don't need to make any sacrifices. It will charge my devices, and it when it is done with them it will charge its internal battery. I also love that when it is in battery mode it will charge at 3 amps instead of the usual 2.1 or 2.4 amp. It seems like the battery also charges faster than most 5000 mAh batteries too.
customer_reviews.author: John T.

customer_reviews.title: Great for traveling
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for traveling. The built in portable charger makes this product unique from the rest. I can’t tell you how much this feature has helped me while on the go. If I could change one thing about this product it would be that I wish it would charge your device and itself while plugged into the wall, otherwise there is nothing wrong with it.
customer_reviews.author: Romie Patel

customer_reviews.title: Anker customer service plus great product equals customer for life!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the handy little device for travel and general use. Worked great for about year and then failed to charge. Contacted Anker customer service and after providing some information they kindly replaced the defective product. I have bought several Anker products and have had great success and satisfaction with them. On the occasional time that there was an issue. Anker stood by their product and replaced it. I buy Anker with great piece of mind!
customer_reviews.author: John F

customer_reviews.title: Short Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these many years ago and it DID give me 2 full charges on my iphone. Lately it was giving me only about half a charge, and I figured it was just old, so I got a new one. Now this new one also gives me 50% charge... useless
customer_reviews.author: Meagan Materazo

customer_reviews.title: Super convenient charger and external battery
customer_reviews.text: Whenever I travel or go to the office, this is the charger I bring with me. It’s so convenient to have an AC adapter that’s also an external battery. Sure, it isn’t as powerful as other external batteries you can get, but it doesn’t take up a lot of space and allows you to charge two devices at once while also being plugged into a wall! Plus you can charge it that way, instead of having to connect it with a micro USB cable to another wall plug, which requires that you have a separate AC adapter. It’s affordable, very useful, and SO CONVENIENT!
customer_reviews.author: Nathalie Schrans

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Must-have for people who are frequently on-the-go.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product. The only reason I didn’t rate this product 5 stars is because of its shape. It tends to want to fall out of sockets if they’re a little more loose due to the weight distribution. However, I know I’m being petty and this truly is a great product. It combines 2 charging bricks and a battery pack into one item, that is nearly the same size as my MacBook Pro charging brick. This is an excellent product and I would highly recommend for anyone who’s frequently on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: A must.
customer_reviews.text: I don't have to carry a battery pack and a wall adapter anymore! this is one of the best battery packs I own as I can use it wherever. It holds about two chargers from what I can tell and if really needed I can charge two phones if I'm out with friends. One thing I do question is how I'm not really sure when it starts charging my phone and then the pack itself, as it seems i have to click the button to start charging my phone, I assumed it would be automatic.
customer_reviews.author: G. A. Romero

customer_reviews.title: Reduces Clutter, Fast Charges, Great Price.
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this for about two weeks but so far it has proven to be an excellent purchase. It has no trouble charging an IPad Pro 9.7 Inch and an IPhone 6 Plus simultaneously. Its definitely reduces cable and charger clutter as it reduces the number of chargers and cables i have to carry for my older power bank. I cant vouch for the number of times it can charge a device, but after spending 20 hours flying / waiting in airports on Thanksgiving weekend I did not go without. It charges as fast as the OEM Apple Charges. It also has a solid sturdy feel to it. Very well made. Another win for Anker.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M.

customer_reviews.title: Original unit Died after 6 months. Replacement sent :)
customer_reviews.text: Edit: immediately after writing this review, Anker contacted me and sent me another unit free of charge. So far so good; seems to be working well. Thank you Anker! My unit stopped working after six months. It was convenient because it charged directly via a wall outlet and doubled as a USB port when you didn't have another wall plug. However, it turned out to be a waste of a few bucks.
customer_reviews.author: J. Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Gret design. Great power!
customer_reviews.text: A cool device to charge your device! I saw this with my friend and i am really interested so i did buy it. Ive been a loooong time anker user. I originally bought their powercore 20,000 mah back in 2016. I'm still using it to this date. Thats why i love anker products. It has dual purpose. You can charge it without a cable is the best thing! I wish it had more mAh. But 5,000 is enough for a 2 full chrge for my iPhone x. Great engineering!
customer_reviews.author: Aldrin

customer_reviews.title: Works inconsistently
customer_reviews.text: This is a great idea -- a charger that also doubles as a battery bank. The problem is that it works inconsistently. When plugged in it sometimes charges my phone and sometimes charges itself. Sometimes I can switch the function to charge the phone by pushing the button, but sometimes that doesn't work. It is light, though.
customer_reviews.author: Ilikenature

customer_reviews.title: Very neat portable charger/power brick
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I’ve owned a lot of Anker power bricks and wanted a portable one for home/range. It’s nice to be able to fast charge my phone. Then when I head out to shoot at the range just grab it and toss it in my bag. The sides do get mildly warm but nothing scary and I can get maybe 1.5 charges on my iPhone XR but really it’s for my rechargeable lights at the range.
customer_reviews.author: Iztup87

customer_reviews.title: Great product and value for the money you paid
customer_reviews.text: I bought this "Anker PowerCore Fusion, Portable Charger 5000mAh with Dual USB Wall Charger, Foldable Plug and PowerIQ, Battery Pack for iPhone, iPad, Android, Samsung Galaxy and More" during May 2017 and it's really great working and I like the Anker products more because of their quality and they keep up their promises. Whomever wants to purchase a great and extraordinary product I would recommend Anker products. Now, I have anker 2 in 1 wall charger and powerbank, 2 Apple lighting cables valid for lifetime. Though the anker products are little cost compared to other products. I will say Anker is the best and my all time favorite. Now, I'm planning to buy the same anker charger one more..
customer_reviews.author: Sundararajan

customer_reviews.title: The best charger ever.
customer_reviews.text: I like this charger because I can charge my phone and tablet any where and both at the same time it has to USB ports. I no longer have to look for outlets when the battery on my phone gets low I just plug it into the charger. It is so simple to use, plug in your phone using this charger. Then when your phone is charged so is this charger then just take it with you. The company stands by their warranty, mine stopped working and they replaced quick and easy. I have recommended this to all my friends. I also recommend the power line USB cords very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Noramary

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre
customer_reviews.text: I expected more from this charger. I’d had one of the old school ones in the past and it worked amazingly but this one isn’t quite as up to the task. Don’t get me wrong it does charge, but it feels like it runs out very quickly. With the high reviews I thought it’d be comparable to the one I had in the past, but if I’m honest it’s a bit of a let down. I wish I’d gotten the older, uglier style to use.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Faustus

customer_reviews.title: Great portable charger!
customer_reviews.text: This thing never leaves my side. We have two and use them to charge everything from phones to game controllers. Seriously a lifesaver in a pinch and keeps my phone going all day if I'm using it heavily!
customer_reviews.author: Jessi C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for everyday commute
customer_reviews.text: Great way to consolidate everyday use items. Altho bigger than a stand-alone dual usb outlet charger and smaller than the previous backup battery size I carry, this fits my daily routine perfectly. Enough emergency power to get me through my commute, and it recharges on its own after i finish charging up my phone while plugged into an outlet at the office or at home. I still carry my big anker 20000mah battery for longer trips and vacays, but for everyday regular use, this is perfect
customer_reviews.author: mr. e

customer_reviews.title: 2nd unit doesn’t match the 1st
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these a year ago, ended up leaving it with a co-worker who liked it so much it never found its way back to me (it’s okay, it was Christmas time). Really liked its performance so I ordered another one. This unit just doesn’t live up to the expectations set by the first. It takes longer to charge my phones and iPad, and it just doesn’t last nearly as long as the first one did. It still seems to function but I was so pleased by the first one that I’m kind of disappointed this time around.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Best backup charger!
customer_reviews.text: I love this charger! I have bought one for every member of my family because I loved it so much! It charged an iPhone VERY quickly. An iPad takes much longer to charge, and I can’t get a full charge on my iPad on the backup battery. I like that I can charge my phone overnight while also charging the device for later. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Emily Powers

customer_reviews.title: We took this on a trip to Switzerland and Germany ...
customer_reviews.text: We took this on a trip to Switzerland and Germany. Using this in combination with a travel adapter meant we didn't have to worry about voltage differences when plugging in our devices. It also was critical on our day trips and recharging our cell phones. For scale this is about the size of a man's palm
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Compact, high quality, works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: This works exactly as advertised, looks and feels high quality, even the packaging is excellent, it is quite compact, and the battery provides the full 5Ah. The only way they could make this better would be to have the power not glitch on the USB output when AC power is removed...then it could serve as a UPS for USB devices as well; unfortunately there is a momentary interruption in power when it switches from charging to discharging the battery.
customer_reviews.author: David Albert

customer_reviews.title: Only charger you'll ever need
customer_reviews.text: Love this Charger! I usually just leave it plugged in to my wall, but I love how I can unplug it and take it with me wherever I go. It was great because I didnt have an outlet next to my bed, so I would just unplug this and have it on my nightstand so I could charge my phone at night. I love the flexibility it gives me. And the foldable prongs are great!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hatch

customer_reviews.title: Good, but short lived
customer_reviews.text: After only a few months it doesn't charge in or out worth a damn. The wall plug is sturdy and moves freely when you want it to. Very heavy even for its capacity. 2 usb ports haven't given out even after constant use. The micro port doesn't charge the battery. Recently it takes 5h of charging to fill, used to be 3h when I first got it Recently it won't increase my battery % on my phone if I charge and look at a black web page.
customer_reviews.author: lovingmalice

customer_reviews.title: Super Durable. Great battery life!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS CHARGER! It can charge my phone twice on a full charge. It can charge 2 diffrent things at once which is so amazing. I lost is after a year but loved it so much I just had to buy it again. It is super durable as well. I have dropped this thing so many times. While camping, off the counter. I even dropped it in the sink once but slapped that bad boi in some rice and it worked perfectly again. I would 10/10 recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! It's my de-facto charger/adapter for my Google Pixel phone. 1) I love having a dual-port charger that's also a battery 2) It charges quickly 3) The built-in wall prongs are great 4) From the USB-to-USB-C, my phone is quick-charged 5) The size and weight of the PowerCore Fusion is really just about perfect My only complaint? I wish the battery were larger! Hopefully they'll release a 10,000+ mAh version soon :)
customer_reviews.author: S. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Convenient dual purpose adapter
customer_reviews.text: The powercore fusion stays in my backpack and I use it whenever I'm traveling. Many planes still don't have reliably working/full-power USB ports so I'll use this to arrive fully charged. It can recharge my phone at least once very quickly, especially when compared to the slow 5w apple adapter. It is pretty light and can even fit into a coat pocket on a chilly day. With this adapter, I don't need to carry a separate usb power adapter. My favorite feature is the retracting power prongs so this won't scratch up anything else. The adapter has held up well over the past year since purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sterling

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: Expected better from anker, not sure if I got a defective product but battery life is mediocre at best. I have a knock-off of this and its way better. I've had anker and never had this issue. I'm so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: jose

customer_reviews.title: this is an ANKER product with the best engineering, production and customer service anywhere
customer_reviews.text: When you're on the road you still need a charging system for your devices. Instead of carrying a plug-in wall wart and a power block for when you can't plug in, why not carry both in one unit? Also when the wall wart has finished charging your devices, it charges itself. Plus, this is an ANKER product with the best engineering, production and customer service anywhere. Am I a happy customer?? You Bet!
customer_reviews.author: feelgud

customer_reviews.title: It seems like such a simple thing
customer_reviews.text: It seems like such a simple thing: a battery for recharging iPhone and iPad that doesn't require a charger and charger cable. My wife is a flight attendant and basically carries her life in her suitcases for three days; every ounce counts, every cable/charger is in danger of being lost. So this was a great find. Works perfectly, requires only cablel to phone/iPad.
customer_reviews.author: J. Eaton

customer_reviews.title: Quite convenient
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy charger, good build quality, fits perfectly into the plug with no wobble. The size and weight are more travel friendly than expected. The charging is smooth and swift on both AC and DC (battery). I don't mind paying few more bucks for 2 important features, the first is atleast one USB-C port and the second is the Qualcomm Quickcharge support. If these 2 features could be implemented (ofcourse we always like more ampere hours, but the size may get bigger) it will be the best in this category.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for busy people
customer_reviews.text: This product helps me keep my phone charged. I’m a busy, hard-working family man. Sometimes my phone is nearly dead, but I have tasks to complete. The charger offers battery charging without an outlet. Sometimes I can not get to an outlet or I don’t have time to leave it on the outlet, so this is perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Buckley

customer_reviews.title: Works okay, original MSRP too high for what it is
customer_reviews.text: I got this for $20 on sale and that's the most I'd pay for it. I have a travel router from Hootoo that's not only larger in capacity (1000 mAh more) but it's the same footprint of it with the addition of a router! Not to mention the Hootoo travel router puts out the same amperage across the two ports in battery mode that this does and it's seamless from outlet to battery power, this isn't... there is a slight gap between when you plug/ unplug where you lose power. For what it is I think Anker has this priced too high
customer_reviews.author: Michael S

customer_reviews.title: Great solution - check for updated version from Anker.
customer_reviews.text: Why carry a plug and cord to charge your charger to charge your phone? Why not just carry a charger that has power built in? This is the answer to redundant crap in your travel bag. This is a must buy for anyone that travels. This just simplifies your life, and you're never left hanging in a panic with a dead phone, tablet, or BT device.
customer_reviews.author: Mookiebeck

customer_reviews.title: Great accessory for your mobile devices!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my sister-in-law for Christmas and she really seemed to like it. I have many Anker products and they all work exceptionally well. I have no doubt this product is working well for her. Anker is a brand I just keep coming back to for their amazingly well built products and phenomenal customer service.
customer_reviews.author: A.C.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: As all Anker products, this ranks up there with all of them, love that there are two USB ports and it’s extra nice that it can be used as extra charger. I own 3 Anker products great for traveling I’ve never run out of power and never had a problem at airport when carrying on all 3 in backpack.
customer_reviews.author: IG1323

customer_reviews.title: Great charger. One of my best purchases
customer_reviews.text: This charger has been a life saver. I am able to charge multiple devices with it and it keeps my phone alive for most of the day. Some things: -does not really charge Ipad when it’s unplugged. It mostly keeps it alive and makes the battery die slower. -Keep it plugged constantly so you can just grab it and use it
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Miguel Cabrera

customer_reviews.title: EDC Must Have!
customer_reviews.text: this thing is awesome. since i received it in the mail, it hasnt left my sight. it charges itself and my phobe at night(quite fast) then in the morning i take it to work with me and wherever i go. my phonee is always charged up and i dont worry about "power saving" anymore.. the case that comes with it makes it a breeze. it is a bit bulky so the case made it easier to carry around. Love this thing!!
customer_reviews.author: ryan daley

customer_reviews.title: Super convenient backup battery
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep around the house because my wife and I are constantly at critically low battery level right when we need to leave the house. Most of our quick trips aren't long enough for car chargers to really make much progress so I wanted a battery to toss in a bag. This is super simple to just leave it plugged up to an outlet in a common area in the house. Then when we need to blitz out the door, we just grab it and go. It usually had enough juice to get both of our phones charged back up.
customer_reviews.author: David Paulk

customer_reviews.title: Trustworthy and fair prices
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my son during his bus rides during g summer to and from Camp which was about 45 mins each way and wouldn't have to charge it again for about 3 or 4 days.Love the color options, the red is great and easy to spot rather then the usual black. 2👍👍☝️
customer_reviews.author: Flex

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely LOVE the PowerCore
customer_reviews.text: Great and innovative product from Anker! I travel 80% for work, so I'm constantly dragging my laptop bag around. Combining a wall charger with a battery pack, this reduced the space and weight of lugging around two separate items. Also, I would always forget to charge my old battery pack - not an issue with the PowerCore as it charges when plugged into the wall. If you travel or aren't always near an outlet, the PowerCore Fusion is for you!
customer_reviews.author: Bill Platten

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommendable. Best dual function charger I own.
customer_reviews.text: After almost a year of use still the best portable charger I own. It’s multi-functionality is great and 2 ports helps you and a friend/loved one charge at the same time. I play a bunch of battery draining games and this helps me keep going for literal days (Pokemon go). It can be used while plugged into a wall or on the go.
customer_reviews.author: irwin

customer_reviews.title: Best charger/powerbank ever!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I'm always killing my phone at work then going out after i get home with enough time to recharge. With this I plug my phone in when I get home and when I leave the house I take the charger with me and it seemlessly switches to charging off the powerbank. I don't know how I survived with out this niffty little charger before.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kurzhals

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: Favorite gift that several friends and family received this year. Charging multiple devices as well as the ability to charge the battery pack itself directly from the wall is appreciated. My daughter used it at a theme park and charged five friends phones from it before finding a plug to recharge it so they could go the entire day without their phones going dead.
customer_reviews.author: McFamily

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I recently reached out to Anker because of an issue I had with the Power Fusion 5000 I purchased last year. It was working fine in March. When I went to use it recently, it would no longer charge despite a 24 hour charge. No lights, no charge, nothing. I sent an email to customer service and they responded right away. They replaced my charger without me having to return my "dud." They followed up with me each step of the way. It isn't often that you get customer service this good.
customer_reviews.author: imelda :-)

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This friend is literally my favorite portable charger. It can plug into a wall and charge its self and your devices at the same time, but if you can’t find a plug, it has enough battery to keep your devices running. Whenever I travel, I always make sure to take this with me. I love that it is small enough to just throw into a bag and not worry about extra weight. Simply amazing!!!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great for traveling
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a backup because the last time I traveled my phone cord stopped working. I panic so bought this to always have.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Estep

customer_reviews.title: Anker = Great Products and Outstanding Service!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased a good number of Anker products for both office and home with zero problems. This PowerCore was to replace one I left in a hotel room and arrived with an issue. It would never reach full capacity (only charge to 2 LED's). A quick message to customer service, and heard back from them right away. They were beyond helpful, and prompt, and got it replaced ASAP. Outstanding customer service! Glad this one is red so my scatterbrained self is less likely to leave it in another hotel room!
customer_reviews.author: B. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great battery pack
customer_reviews.text: I have meany of anker potable chargers. This one is the most realistic. The other ones hold a longer charg but you need to vary around a charger with them to keep them charged and they weigh a lot. This one is light weight and can be plugged directly into the wall and used to charge your phone wile the battery pack is charging. Best one I have bought Eb so far.
customer_reviews.author: chelstin

customer_reviews.title: My wife literally uses this every day
customer_reviews.text: We don't have an easily accessible charging port near our couch, so she just pulls this off the wall and uses it to charge her phone. We also take it with us on vacation in case we need an emergency charge. It's been quite the useful little bugger, and while it is significantly bigger than a regular charger, the extra utility is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Omg how did I live without this??
customer_reviews.text: This is a great charger. I have used cheaper ones and they are stupid compared to this. The cord fits perfectly. It charges my phone in about an hour or so from 40% and has a super tight connection. It is a bit heavy but it's a battery after all. I would buy this model again and again. I like that it plugs straight into a wall which I know I will always be able to find unlike a port. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Vicky DeNero

customer_reviews.title: Perfect balance between weight, power, and features
customer_reviews.text: A great mix of features and design. Charges both from wall power or a standard USB charger. Can be used as a standard charger (plug it in the wall, plug your device into one of the two USB ports) and it will first charge your device(s) then charge itself. A good balance between weight and power, this has gained a place in my day to day backpack along with a Cafele retractable Lightning/MicroUSB cable. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Leeds

customer_reviews.title: Was a great product, but now looses charge.
customer_reviews.text: Used to love this product, but battery life has been poor recently. The concept of having a charger brick being the battery pack was genius. I bought one for each of my kids. Plug in one thing and they've got the phone and battery pack both charged. No more dead phone on the bus on the way home. It used to charge phone 3 times before dying, but now only charged it up 10%. Sad to say I'm now looking around for a replacement product that might last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Hopefully  just this unit was fualty
customer_reviews.text: I love anker products usb cords and portable power banks that ive used for years and use them for all my electronics i thought this would have been a great convenient buy but it didnt hold up after a couple uses it did not hold the charge at all and even to use at home as a ac power supply it takes my note 8 what seems like a day to fully charge.

product_meta.title: Anker PowerCore Fusion 5000, Portable Charger 5000mAh 2-in-1 with Dual USB Wall Charger, Foldable AC Plug and PowerIQ, Battery Pack for iPhone, iPad, Android, Samsung Galaxy, and More, Black
product_meta.description: Color:BlackPowerCore Fusion 5000 The High-Speed Portable & Wall Charger From ANKER, America's Leading USB Charging Brand - Faster and safer charging with our advanced technology - 50 million+ happy users and counting - 99% Positive Feedback A New Charging Dimension PowerCore Fusion perfectly combines the reliability of a wall charger and the convenience of a portable charger. It takes the best of both charging worlds to create Anker's most versatile charger ever. High-Speed Charging Anker's exclusive PowerIQ and VoltageBoost technologies deliver the fastest possible charge to phones, tablets, GPSs, game consoles, and any other USB devices. (Does not Support Qualcomm Quick Charge. ) Home and Away PowerCore Fusion charges itself and other devices from any AC outlet. It first charges your device then recharges itself (in 2. 5 hours)—ready to be taken on-the-go. Away from the wall, it'll recharge an iPhone 7 twice and other smart phones at least once. AC Input: 100-240V~0. 5A 50-60Hz Micro USB Input: 5V=2A USB Output (when plugged into AC): 5V=2. 1A (2. 1A Max Each Port) USB Output (when not plugged into AC): 5V=3A (3A Max Each Port) What’s In the Box - PowerCore Fusion 5000 - Micro USB cable - Travel Pouch - Welcome Guide Note: To recharge PowerCore Fusion, disconnect external devices or press the button—charging will commence after 30 seconds. LEDs will continue for 10 seconds after disconnecting cables and unplugging. Use the included Micro-USB cable, your original cable or a third-party certified one (such as MFi). Please use your original Apple charging cable (not included) to charge Apple products. Compatible with most USB-charged devices, including iPhone 8 / X / XS / XS Max / XR (Lightning cable required), Android smartphones and tablets (including the Nexus 7). Not compatible with the iPod nano, iPod Classic; Not for devices with an input below 50mA (e. g. some Bluetooth headsets and GPS devices).
feature_bullets: The Anker Advantage: Join the 50 million+ powered by America's leading USB charging brand.
The Ultimate 2-in-1 Charger: A hybrid high-capacity portable battery and dual-port wall charger in one sleek package.

High-Speed Charging: In the wall or on-the-go, Anker's exclusive PowerIQ and VoltageBoost technologies ensure that all devices receive their fastest possible charge. Does not support Qualcomm Quick Charge.

Charge-and-Go: Charge your device and PowerCore Fusion's internal battery via a wall outlet, then take it with you for up to 3 phone charges—any place, any time. Boasts a foldable plug to ensure maximum portability.
What You Get: PowerCore Fusion 5000, 2ft micro USB cable, travel pouch, welcome guide, our 18-month worry-free and friendly customer service.
